name: Four Seasons Hotel Boston

reviews.text: There are some renovations going on but the service is still impeccable. Loved having a room overlooking the Public Garden, especially when it snowed. The pool and spa areas are always welcoming. The renovated room showers are fabulous.
reviews.title: As always, The Four Seasons Boston is perfection.

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Four Seasons for two nights in March to attend a conference. The hotel staff is incredibly friendly and very helpful. The pool provides amazing views of the Boston Commons, and the restaurant and bar is exceptional. I have stayed at this hotel multiple times for work and will hopefully be returning soon.
reviews.title: My Favorite Hotel In Boston

reviews.text: For a weekend getaway from NYC with a 7 and 4 year old, we looked at Boston, Baltimore and DC. Based on the blog traffic for the Four Seasons Boston for family travel we decided to give it a shot. Let me tell you, it was perfect. There was not a miss step or hick-up in the plan they created for receiving and entertaining families with children. From the "passport" program when they arrived, to movie night, snacks sent to the room announcing Movie Night and the children's robes and slippers all were perfectly orchestrated.
reviews.title: No better place for families traveling to Boston

reviews.text: The pool area, while not looking child friendly, is completely child friendly and a must see on a family trip.
reviews.title: Best in Boston

reviews.text: The Bristol Lounge has great fare and does a good job with the children's menus and the staff works hard to keep the kids entertained while the parents enjoy their meal.
reviews.title: Gala in Boston - Four Season Saved The Day
Great Location
reviews.text: Great location hotel, next to park close to the historic area and shopping we had a very quite room, nice breakfast, good room, excellent late 4pm checkout for our late flight. Helpful valet parking and front desk.

reviews.title: Four Seasons to the Rescue - 10 Stars
reviews.text: Standing in the lobby of a nearby hotel experiencing a dreadful check-in that was wrought with issues, I took a shot in the dark and called the Four Seasons. After quickly explaining my current challenge, I was invited over to the Four Seasons with assurances not to "worry about anything." Upon identifying myself at the front desk, I was not only checked in quickly, but was also gifted with the surprise of having the room rate of the first hotel honored. Shortly after I settled in my room, an answer to a knock on the door brought the added generosity of a fruit and cheese snack, courtesy of the front desk. Let me just say, the Four Seasons gained a raving fan for life! They could have just checked me in at a last minute rack rate and moved on, but instead they kept me financially whole, upgraded my room, and went above and beyond to take care of me. In reflection, I experienced the difference in what a customer experiences when responsible employees are permitted and empowered to make decisions. Thank you, Four Seasons Boston.

reviews.title: Flawless stay at Four Seasons Boston
reviews.text: Had a late evening check-in for overnight stay. Staff was fantastic. Was able to get to my room quickly. Had a nicely renovated bathroom, tasteful and modern and works with overall feel of hotel. Ordered room service, arrived right on time...would have liked to have enjoyed longer leisurely meal, but had to get to work.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heard about the garden and bee apiary, great to have "locally-sourced" ingredients for the restaurant and hotel. Didn't get to use, but checked out the pool, would definitely take advantage of it on another stay.
reviews.title: Overwhelmed with Gratitude.

reviews.text: It was a special night to begin with...I proposed to my girlfriend (she said Yes!). I surprised her with a night at the Four Seasons, overlooking the Gardens in which I popped the big question. I was expecting a special night of luxury for us - what the hotel and its staff delivered was so much more. Of course every corner of the hotel was stunning: the grand and gorgeous lobby; the perfectly appointed room; the whole place was just an incredible treat for us - two young, modest 20-somethings who don't typically have the money for such luxury. But while I was a little intimidated by the sheer supreme class of it all, the staff made me feel immediately at ease the second I checked in. It didn't seem to matter that we were young, potentially a little under-dressed, or a gay couple. EVERYONE (down to the car attendants out front and the voices who picked up the room service phone) was so overwhelming kind! They delivered a special, complimentary dessert treat for us: delicious berries dipped in chocolate on a beautiful plate with 'Congratulations' scrawled perfectly in delicate chocolate drizzle. Even though we were just staying one night, and they certainly have more prestigious guests than we, the staff made us feel like we were royalty - the most important couple in the whole place. I got respectfully, knowing smiles from the other staff in the lobby and glowing, genuine well-wishes as we checked out. They made the stay absolutely PERFECT. I credit myself with the idea of surprising her with the Four Seasons...but I credit the hotel with making it the most romantic and brilliant night for her...for us.
reviews.title: Just perfect for a wedding

reviews.text: My husband and I were in Boston at the Four Seasons late February and we had a very nice reception. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our suite was large and quite comfortable and we can't wait to return. The staff's recommendations for dinner were excellent choices for us. Thanks!
reviews.title: Grand Time at Fours Seasons Boston

reviews.text: We stay at the Four Seasons Boston at least twice a year. Every time it has been a delight. We travel with our young son, and they are always so kind to him upon arrival--a toy and coloring book, and later, once we are settled, they deliver a snack boat with a cookie, Yahoo, and pudding. He loves it. We usually order room service and have found the service prompt, professional and friendly. They go the extra mile -- they know who you are when you call down, and even if you have special concerns (son has a nut allergy -- so they make sure there are none in the room.) Consistent quality, professional and courteous manner, and excellent attention to detail.
reviews.title: Wonderful location in the heart of everything

reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed for several days at the Four Seasons-Boston for a conferance. This was our third stay in the last 10 years. We must say, without question, this is the finest ,and most consistent, place we have ever stayed.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in many hotels in both the US and Europe and without question this is the most wonderful.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring Boston

reviews.text: The staff is world-class and personal. But not over-bearing.
reviews.title: Another fabulous Four Seasons

reviews.text: We've stayed here a few times, mostly because of the location -- it's central for both work related meetings and leisure travel. The rooms are clean and thoughtfully appointed, if rather old fashioned in their style. Bathrooms have lovely L'Occitane products, but we always wish they had better bathtubs appropriate for a a good soak.
reviews.title: Truly amazing staff in the time of crisis

reviews.text: We've also always appreciated the service, and although this is part of large, albeit upscale, chain, the staff has never seem scripted but rather have a more personal approach. However, we never fully appreciated the extent of the staff training until our last visit. We were staying at the Boston Four Seasons while the manhunt for the Boston Bombers unfolded. We could not have been more impressed by the hotel's reaction to this crisis. They kept all guests well informed and also comfortable under the most difficult of circumstance. We are truly thankful and commend the hotel staff for everything they did.
reviews.title: Top Notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing staff at this great hotel. Travelling with 2 small children they went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. From the pool amenities provided (swim diapers, arm bands) to the toys we borrowed for the room, dvd's from their massive selection, mini robes and slippers for the kids. Our children cant stop asking when they can go back! Concierge's were amazing and very helpful. Location couldnt get better, walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. We used the house car as well as a hired car (through hotel), both were great. Will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable stay

reviews.text: Stayed four nights, the room was comfortable, if a bit small. The staff was great -- stored 4 bags for me for a week before my arrival and generally was extremely helpful and accommodating. Only issue is that there was a long hair on one of the night pillows when we arrived, though this was quickly taken care of and the manager sent up a handwritten apology and bottle of wine. Overall recommended.
reviews.title: Classy but comfortable

reviews.text: Have been staying at the Boston Four Seasons for years. They consisitently provide excellent service without smothering you.
reviews.title: The Best

description: Located in Boston's Back Bay, Four Seasons Hotel Boston houses 273 guest rooms including 77 luxury suites, many with postcard views of Boston's Public Garden, Beacon Hill and the gilded dome of the State House. Enjoy convenient access to Newbury Street - the Rodeo Drive of the East - as well as Charles Street's charm and the vibrant Theater District. Ideal for business and leisure travelers alike, the Hotel features exceptional complimentary amenities including: pool and 24-hour Fitness Center, Business Center, Wi-Fi, House Car and coffee & muffins in the lobby each morning. Children enjoy the Kids Passport Program, Cookie Making Classes, the chance to "Raid the Fridge" for a midnight snack, and so much more. Couples delight in The Bristol Lounge, Boston's favorite restaurant and Bar, featuring house aged steaks, the famous Bristol Burger, hand-rolled pastas, signature martinis, and nightly events including the decadent Sundaes on Saturdays Dessert Buffet. Four Seasons Hotel Boston is known for its longstanding tradition of warm, welcoming, wonderful service that makes it a true home away from home for travelers. There's so much to enjoy within Four Seasons Hotel Boston's walls - and just outside our front door.
